learning_outcomes: Understand and use familiar everyday expressions and very basic phrases aimed at the satisfaction of needs of a concrete type.
Introduce him/herself and others and can ask and answer simple questions about personal details such as where he/she lives, people he/she knows and things he/she has.
Interact in a very simple way provided the other person talks slowly and clearly and is prepared to help.
Recognize familiar names, words, and very simple sentences, for example on notices and posters or in catalogues.

language_focus_topics: Verb 'to be' (am/is/are) ‚Äì positive, negative, question forms.
Subject pronouns (I, you, he, she, it, we, they).
Possessive adjectives (my, your, his, her, its, our, their).
Demonstratives: This is ‚Ä¶ / That is... / These are ... / Those are...
Basic questions with 'be' (e.g., What's this?, Where is...?, Is this...?).
Nouns: singular and basic regular plurals (-s, -es).
Basic prepositions of place (in, on, under).
Day 1 Grammar - 'It is': What is it?, Is it ...?, Is it ... or ...?, It is ..., It is not ..., It is not ... but it is...
vocabulary_topics: Day 1: Basic Words and Phrases: hello, goodbye, yes, no, thank you, you're welcome, please, alright/ok, one, tea, coffee, water, juice, beer, wine, cash, card.
Basic everyday objects (e.g., book, pen, table, chair, door, window, bag, phone, key, computer).
Colors (e.g., red, blue, green, yellow, black, white, orange, pink, brown, grey, purple).
Countries (own country and common English-speaking ones e.g., UK, USA, Canada, Australia).
Nationalities (own nationality and common ones e.g., British, American, Canadian, Australian).
Personal information (name, age - "My name is...", "I am [Name].", "I am ... years old.").
Immediate family relations (mother, father, sister, brother, parents).
Basic adjectives for description (e.g., big, small, good, bad, happy, sad, new, old, beautiful, ugly).
Days of the week (Monday to Sunday).
Basic food and drink items (e.g., apple, banana, bread, water, milk, coffee, tea).
pronunciation_focus_topics: Recognizing and producing sounds of the English alphabet.
Distinguishing between similar-sounding letters (e.g., b/p, d/t, g/k).
Basic word stress on familiar words (e.g., 'HELlo', 'PENcil').
Simple intonation for statements (falling) and yes/no questions (rising).
listening_comprehension_skills: Recognize familiar words and very basic phrases concerning him/herself, his/her family and immediate concrete surroundings when people speak slowly and clearly.
Understand simple greetings, introductions, and farewells.
Follow very simple instructions in the classroom (e.g., 'Open your book', 'Listen', 'Look').
Identify numbers, colors, and names of familiar objects when heard.
reading_comprehension_skills: Understand familiar names, words and very simple sentences, for example on notices, posters, labels, or in catalogues.
Recognize the letters of the English alphabet in print.
spoken_interaction_skills: Use basic greetings and leave-taking expressions (Hello, Hi, Good morning, Good afternoon, Good evening, Goodbye, Bye).
Use basic social expressions (Thank you, Please, You're welcome, Sorry, Excuse me).
Introduce oneself and others simply ("My name is [Name].", "This is [Name].").
Ask and answer simple questions about name, age, and origin ("What's your name?", "How old are you?", "Where are you from?").
Respond to simple questions with 'yes' or 'no'.
Make very simple requests (e.g., "A coffee, please.").
spoken_production_skills: Use simple phrases and sentences to name familiar people and objects.
State one's name, age, and country of origin.
Produce simple isolated phrases and very basic sentences about oneself and immediate surroundings.
written_interaction_skills: Respond to simple written prompts with single words or short phrases (e.g., filling in name on a list).
written_production_skills: Write the letters of the English alphabet (uppercase and lowercase).
Write one's own name, age, and nationality.
Copy familiar words and short simple sentences.
Fill in a very simple form with personal details (name, nationality, date of birth - basic).
cultural_competence_topics: Basic forms of address (Mr., Mrs., Miss - though Ms. is often preferred for women).
Awareness of some English-speaking countries and their flags.
Understanding that 'please' and 'thank you' are very important.
learning_strategies_suggestions: Practice the alphabet and sounds daily using charts or apps.
Use flashcards with pictures for new vocabulary (objects, colors, numbers).
Listen to and repeat simple English songs or nursery rhymes.
Label common household items in English.
Try to say hello and goodbye in English to classmates or teacher.
